file_content.text: Shot between the eyes'll put him down for good.
He isn't gone, but he will be soon.
He doesn't look well, sir. I think he's down.
Step carefully, he may not be finished.
Life readings minimal. He's dying.
It's your responsibility now--everything we built, everything we hid from you... you're the only one like us left.
You'll take good care of it. But between you and me... I want to show you one last thing.
One last thing. You have my attention.
All right.
Hold still. I'll get you a medpac.
You're not dying yet.
It's a little late for that. Come here.
I was trained by the best. Killers, slicers--I even went to Tatooine to see the Old Man.
I haven't shown anyone my real face in a long time.
Hunter wasn't only a cover for the SIS. You fooled the Star Cabal.
Tell me who you really are.
No. But so long as I was good, they didn't care how I looked.
How can you be a woman?
"Hunter" is really female?
The usual way.
I was a little girl when they found me. They erased my name, my planet... eventually, it's easier to make up someone new.
Then you came along--you kept your face when you became Cipher Nine, and I was so jealous--but we had fun....
Being brainwashed and tortured isn't what I call fun.
Weren't you trying to kill me?
Ha! You're a liar--you like it all, don't you?
I can't imagine what it was like. But you don't have to lie now.
I really do understand.
I still want to. It's hard not to look at you with his eyes.
By the time you came along, it was too late to change. But you understood, you knew I liked you....
I knew. You weren't altogether subtle.
I had some idea, yes.
Mm. I liked that about being him.
People who like me don't brainwash me and have me tortured.
Weren't you trying to kill me?
I kept you alive. I made it fun.
A bad childhood and confusing adolescence doesn't excuse genocide.
You don't deserve my pity.
You sound bitter. Don't be bitter.
Hunter and Cipher Nine... they're the tough ones. They play the game right.
For you, the game is over. Intelligence will decide your fate.
I'm taking you prisoner.
No, they won't.
You were the best enemy I could ask for.
You did great.
Goodbye. Don't ever let them stop you.
You were the best enemy I could ask for.
You did great. [Kiss her]
Goodbye, love. Don't ever let them stop you.
Don't ever compare yourself to me.
It isn't a game. [Kill her]
I don't have any sympathy for a freak like you.
You really are crazy.
That's what I like about you. Your warmth of spirit.
Goodbye, Cipher Nine. It's going to be hell without me....
No more secrets, no more deception.
Not this time. [Kill him]
No way out anymore. I dreamed about this. You and me tearing each other apart....
Who would've figured an Imperial Cipher could threaten us?
You underestimated me. Now where do I find your comrades' names?
Tell me what I want to know.
The Black Codex, back there--everything we are, in one digital box. But I can't just give it to you.
I don't want to hurt you.
Surrender, please!
Why did you have to be Imperial? You would've fit right in--we could've been partners.
You're a sick man with sick dreams.
Shut up. [Attack]
Liar!
I warned you what would happen, but you couldn't stay away from Voss. You had to make waves, kill our special Gormak friend.
Now the votes are in, and you see the consequences of drawing their attention.
The gift is for you. I can't protect you anymore.
Who'd have thought the Star Cabal was so sentimental? Maybe if Intelligence had nurtured our agents more, we'd still be around.
We'll talk to our contacts in the Diplomatic Service. We'll talk to the nest, we'll talk to House Thul, we'll find support.
Shove it. The gig's done, we're out of a job.
Frankly, it's hard to imagine Intelligence being gone.
Intelligence is gone. You can no longer suckle the milk of your masters.
We may've lost Operations, but we know more about the Star Cabal than anyone. They're scared.
We're not finished yet.
They acknowledge our existence. Believe me, I want them exterminated too, but let's not overstate our position.
I thought you were the optimistic one?
Then we really need to spend more time together.
He shows his bitterness. It will become a tactical vulnerability.
All in due time.
What I'd like to know is--what's your plan now?
At least we haven't lost our world for nothing.
Do you have a plan, sir?
In the old days, we could've turned to our favorite analyst for a flash of insight. Not an option now.
Keeper would have an answer.
I know you were close to her. I'm sorry--we keep losing friends.
We've lost friends, but they're not dead.
Yeah, too bad for her. More dead guys for us.
We're losing friends a little quickly.
Complain on your own time. You still work for me.
Don't try my patience.
Yes, sir.
No one's debating your leadership.
But the question remains--what are you planning?
How do you intend to proceed?
Someone wants us on the front lines of Corellia--likely as a trap. I intend to find out why, and follow the answer to our enemy.
Time to hunt the hunters.
Onward, then, into the maw of the dragon. You have my full support.
If we have to go out... you know I'm with you.
Until the end, sir.
Let's hope the Force favors the bold.
Persistence is not a virtuous trait.
Before I decide anything, I want your opinions.
Give me recommendations.
If I've learned one thing over the years, it's this:
When all other paths are closed, you can play dead or you can stir things up and watch for opportunity. Either way, Corellia is our best chance.
If there's a war on, we should be there.
We have our orders, and there's a war going on. We'll find Hunter... but Corellia should come first.
We don't see many options. Someone wants us on Corellia. Maybe there are answers there.
Promise me a shot at the Star Cabal, and I'm in.
We trust in your decision.
I would like to see a war.
We serve the Empire. If we're needed on Corellia, we go to Corellia. Is that understood?
We follow orders.
Understood, sir. Every girl dreams of going to the front lines.
Sometimes serving the Empire means ignoring your superiors.
Understood.
If you die in war, I will inform your loved ones.
I've stuck with you this long--but if you stop fighting back, I'm out.
Begin message:
Cipher. Hope you don't mind my checking in. You weren't expecting any other calls...?
Why are you contacting me, Hunter?
What do you want?
Hunter, my good friend. Who would I rather talk to?
I've always got time for you.
I'm hoping no one. I get jealous.
Why don't you give me your location now and save me the trouble of running a trace?
I should've expected this.
I wouldn't bother--a trace'll take you to a nice old lady on Dantooine.
Your visit to Megasecurity Ward 23 left it in bad shape.... Now, do I come into your house and break your things?
But you finding that holotrap, frying your Keeper's synapses--that's kind of cosmic justice.
You're talking nonsense. Keeper's fine, and I don't know anything about a holotrap.
I don't know what you mean.
Of course.
I saw you meeting with some sort of council. Who were they?
What was that recording?
Old friends of mine. You'd like them, but they're shy.
Everything you've done so far has been reprehensible, but now you've crossed the line.
Hurting Keeper was a mistake.
Love hurts, doesn't it? Believe me, I know.
Once I find you and your bosses, you won't be smirking anymore.
You piece of filth.
Cipher, it's been fun; playing tag, brainwashing you--remember your keyword?
But you keep coming, and we'll destroy your world. No friends, no allies, no Empire left to fight for. Are you ready for that?
If you want me to back off, tell me why you're doing this.
Tell me your real goals.
You're not just playing. You're really worried about me.
You're genuinely concerned.
Who else can I whisper sweet things to?
Do you know what it's like to have no identity? No one in the galaxy who can control you?
It's terrifying and wonderful. If you live to see Imperial Intelligence die... that's me giving you a taste of freedom.
You're assuming I don't stop you first.
We'll see. [Disconnect]
This is Cipher Nine to crew. Prepare for takeoff.
Why couldn't you just die for us? It would've been easy.
Time to see just how good you are.
